pr_title: FCREPO-3201 - Transmission fixity when staging to OCFL object

timeline.message: During a commit, a digest is read from the header file for binaries and provided to the OCFL client for transmission fixity purposes, if there is an appropriate digest available
Use updateObject to create new objects when versioning enabled
Register digests for files modified in a session after write, use those for transmission fixity instead of retrieving from sidecar files
Normalize separators in subpaths during registration

timeline.bodyText: I believe this can remain private.
timeline.author: awoods

replies.bodyText: Ah, I needed it public for an earlier version, but not the final one. Should be fixed now
replies.author: bbpennel

timeline.bodyText: No need to change, but this can now be constructed using List.of().
timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: I don't think you need to walk the staged files, unless you want to. You should just be able to add the entire staging directory, and then iterate over your map of digests, calling addFileFixity for each.
timeline.author: pwinckles

replies.bodyText: Good catch, I was still in the mindset of needing to walk files, but there's really no need at this point. I've switched to your suggestion
replies.author: bbpennel

timeline.message: Refactor adding of files during commit to add the staging path directly and then register digests from map
